comments.author: goofy.bugzilla@gmail.com
comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:2.0b9pre) Gecko/20101231 Firefox/4.0b9pre
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:2.0b9pre) Gecko/20101231 Thunderbird/3.3a2pre

I also hit this annoyance in Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; fr-FR; rv:1.9.2.13) Gecko/20101207 Thunderbird/3.1.7

Testing Ctrl+R (holding) for Reply or other shortkeys do not create this very quick useless repetition.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. highlight one message in the central panel
2. Press Keys Ctrl+0 
3. Leave keys down (hold) more than one second approx

Same experience with Ctrl+N 

Actual Results:  
More than 35 similar tabs are opening with Ctrl+O in one second

More than 35 similar windows are opening with Ctrl+N in one second

Expected Results:  
One is enough, Ctrl+O should open one tab only even if keys are held and Ctrl+N should open one new composition window only

Note that I mentioned here my shortcuts for French they may differ in English but can be found in the Messages dropdown menu
